dcterms:creator: Barry A. Cipra
dcterms:description: The Ising model is a widely-used random model in statistical physics, representing spins on a grid graph where each vertex can be either up (+1.0) or down (âˆ’1.0), influenced by neighboring spins.
dcterms:title: Ising Model

dcterms:creator: Kun Dong
Austin R. Benson
David Bindel
dcterms:description: The U.S. election maps dataset consists of vertices representing counties in the U.S. with edges connecting bordering counties, containing demographic and election statistics used for predicting outcomes.
dcterms:title: U.S. Election Maps

dcterms:creator: David Easley
Jon Kleinberg
dcterms:description: Transportation networks dataset includes traffic data from cities, where each vertex represents a directed lane and edges connect lanes that meet at intersections.
dcterms:title: Transportation Networks

dcterms:creator: Martina Morris
Richard Rothenberg
dcterms:description: The sexual interactions dataset is derived from an HIV transmission study, detailing relationships among individuals, used to predict gender based on race and sexual orientation.
dcterms:title: Sexual Interactions

dcterms:creator: Benedek Rozemberczki
Carl Allen
Rik Sarkar
dcterms:description: The Twitch social network dataset represents online friendships among Twitch streamers, with vertex features derived from streaming statistics used to predict viewer counts.
dcterms:title: Twitch Social Network
